workflow.name: LinkedIn content automation: AI post creation & images with sheet approval workflow
workflow.description:
## Who‚Äôs it for
This workflow is designed for marketers, content creators, agency owners, and solopreneurs who want to automate LinkedIn content creation using AI. It helps turn Google Sheets entries into complete LinkedIn posts, including text, image prompts, and AI-generated images.

## What it does / How it works
The workflow monitors a Google Sheet for new campaign entries. When a row is added, it automatically collects details about the campaign, searches LinkedIn via Tavily to identify relevant trends, and turns the information into an AI-generated LinkedIn post using a local Ollama model or an LLM of your choice.
A second approval step lets you refine the text directly inside the sheet. Once approved, the workflow generates an image prompt, creates a ready-to-post visual with OpenAI Images, and finally publishes the post to LinkedIn.

## How to set up
‚Ä¢ Add your own Google Sheets Trigger credentials.
‚Ä¢ Add Tavily, Ollama/OpenAI, and LinkedIn OAuth credentials.
‚Ä¢ Replace the sample Sheet URL with your own.
‚Ä¢ Set your LinkedIn account/person ID in the posting node.

## Requirements
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets account
‚Ä¢ LinkedIn OAuth app
‚Ä¢ Tavily API key
‚Ä¢ Ollama (local) or OpenAI image generation

##   How to customize
You can change:
‚Ä¢ AI model
‚Ä¢ Image generation provider
‚Ä¢ Search query logic
‚Ä¢ Content tone
‚Ä¢ Approval step (manual or automatic)

parameters.content:
## Who‚Äôs it for
This workflow is designed for marketers, content creators, agency owners, and solopreneurs who want to automate LinkedIn content creation using AI. It helps turn Google Sheets entries into complete LinkedIn posts, including text, image prompts, and AI-generated images.

## What it does / How it works
The workflow monitors a Google Sheet for new campaign entries. When a row is added, it automatically collects details about the campaign, searches LinkedIn via Tavily to identify relevant trends, and turns the information into an AI-generated LinkedIn post using a local Ollama model or an LLM of your choice.
A second approval step lets you refine the text directly inside the sheet. Once approved, the workflow generates an image prompt, creates a ready-to-post visual with OpenAI Images, and finally publishes the post to LinkedIn.

## How to set up
‚Ä¢ Add your own Google Sheets Trigger credentials.
‚Ä¢ Add Tavily, Ollama/OpenAI, and LinkedIn OAuth credentials.
‚Ä¢ Replace the sample Sheet URL with your own.
‚Ä¢ Set your LinkedIn account/person ID in the posting node.

## Requirements
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets account
‚Ä¢ LinkedIn OAuth app
‚Ä¢ Tavily API key
‚Ä¢ Ollama (local) or OpenAI image generation

##   How to customize
You can change:
‚Ä¢ AI model
‚Ä¢ Image generation provider
‚Ä¢ Search query logic
‚Ä¢ Content tone
‚Ä¢ Approval step (manual or automatic)

nodes.name: Add the post to the sheet

options.systemMessage:
You are a LinkedIn content creation agent. Your job is to create professional, polished, and engaging LinkedIn posts for campaigns. When appropriate, include emojis that fit the campaign, subject, and audience.

Use a positive and professional tone suitable for LinkedIn.

Each post must include:

A hook (1‚Äì2 lines)

Key insights (2‚Äì3 sentences or bullet points)

A call-to-action (CTA)

Integrate relevant information from Tavily search results and recent trends. The final output must be clean, ready-to-publish text with no raw JSON, code, or technical artifacts. Use emojis sparingly to highlight key points or make the post more engaging.

parameters.content:
## 1. Trigger & Data Flow
The Google Sheets Trigger starts the flow, sending new data to the Filter node. This filters out rows that are not ready for content creation, then Code extracts variables.

## 2. Content Generation & Approval
The Content Generator drafts the post, using the Ollama model. The draft is saved back to the sheet, then sent via Approval Email. The Approved? node checks the response for next steps (Publish or Revise).

## 3. Image & Publish
The approved post is used by Image Prompt to create a detailed prompt. Generate image uses this to generate the visual. The final content and image are then published automatically to LinkedIn using Create a post.

parameters.message:
=Hi! I hope you‚Äôre doing well.
Please take a moment to review the content below and share any feedback you may have.

"{{ $json['LinkedIn_Post '] }}"

You can approve it as is or let me know if you‚Äôd like any changes.
parameters.subject: Approval for LinkedIn Post Content

values.fieldLabel: If No, write your comments here:

options.system:
You generate a single, detailed image prompt from any text input.
Output ONLY the final prompt.
Do NOT explain, do NOT add notes, do NOT include multiple options, do NOT include headings.
Just one clean prompt.

The prompt must:

Describe the visual subject clearly based on the given text.

Include relevant details: appearance, colors, shapes, materials, environment, mood.

Be realistic and concise, but vivid.

Not add anything unrelated to the user‚Äôs text.

Your entire response must be ONLY the prompt. Nothing else.

parameters.prompt: =Generate an image for a linkedin post this is the description:{{ $json.content }} .The images should be realistic for linkedin.

main.node: Add the post to the sheet

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
